channel.title: How to get more views?
channel.description: So I've been on SoundCloud for a while and I'm not sure how to get more views on my songs. Does anybody know how I could?

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I can confirm that adding tags has helped with views on songs overall. Especially for people outside the Auxy community, the tags help locate songs.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I know it was said as a joke, but it does hint at one important way - proper genre tagging.

By using proper genre tagging, including using meaningful secondary tags, you’re helping SC to understand your track and include it in their automated share/promotion algorithms (‘Related Tracks’, ‘The Upload’, ‘Stations’).

See also: https://blog.landr.com/8-ways-actually-get-heard-soundcloud/

 
Depending on the account type you have (I think), your SC Stats should show you how many times your music has been shared/promoted and played within in each of those three processes.

If you have the Pro Unlimited acct, you get the full set of Stats, including 3rd-party apps and sites that have played your tracks. It’s helpful to know where your audience is.

HTH

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Like Andrew said, I honestly don’t know how some of my tracks get views all of a sudden. I guess you just have to keep making tracks over and over and over again and you will get recognized eventually, trust me. I took me 30 tracks to get 200 views (well I deleted ten tracks now xD but you get the point). If you want to advertise your tracks, ask someone for an invite link to some Auxy discord servers (like Sylex or Auxy Academy) but that’s not absolutely necessary.

Hope this helped!

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
shanebrownofficial:

*How to get your SoundCloud account banned!

Wasn’t planning on doing it. Just curious, because I’m not too sure there is much automated flagging of bot accounts. If there was, I presumably wouldn’t have to keep reporting/blocking followers with same template phrases like “ hot action ” in their description, every few days.

It always amuses/bemuses me the number of real followers those bot/spam accounts have.

 
I had a message recently where the ‘person’ said they were “about to share my track…”. It will get me “at least XXXX plays, XXXX reposts, XXXX follows, etc…. Just follow the link in my profile.”

I naively thought that was kinda cool, even replied saying ‘Thanks for the bump’. Nothing happened. Checked the link in their profile a few days later. Of course, turns out it was a bs message from a paid promo service.

#newb

That account has since been deleted.

If I thought for a second that those listens, reposts and follows would be from real listeners, I might have even stumped up the $10 to see what happens.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: anon6476606
item.description:
I won’t offer any advice on how to get more views, but here’s something you should definitely NOT do: Anything related to fake views, fake likes, and fake reposts. 1) it doesn’t get you anywhere on SoundCloud, 2) SoundCloud’s automatic fake view recognizer will likely remove the stats and keep an eye on your account for future activity, 3) it’s unethical, and 4) if you pay, it’s a waste of money.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: IAATOE
item.description:
BTC is another good way to get noticed. Keep entering them and eventually you’ll make it into the shortlist. This itself grants you views followers and all that stuff especially if you make it into the top 3. Then you can turn your BTC entry into a full song so that little snippet of goodness turns into a full song of well, goodness. A great example of this is Stratosphere by Otszil. Arguably one of best BTC entries to date, it was originally a BTC entry that made it to the top of the shortlist.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Also, remixing is sometimes a route to exposure – even unofficial/bootleg remixing.
A good remix of a popular track can help get you noticed.

On the back of that exposure, you can release original material, with a greater chance of listeners being receptive to your stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get more views?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
On top of what blackocean said…

Getting plays and reposts from Soundcloud users/channels with larger follower lists will help organic growth.

Fwiw, there are also promo channels with hoooj followings that you can submit to. Doesn’t guarantee plays, but can’t hurt (unless you get a rep for submitting ‘sub-par’ stuff – keeping in mind you’re competing for attention against some very tight, highly polished productions – often with vocals, so YMMV.)

YouTube examples are Majestic Casual (3.5M), TheSoundYouNeed (4.2), MrSuicideSheep (7.7M), TrapNation (15M), …

Some are genre-specific, so you might improve your chances if you submit to genre-appropriate channels.

Exposure on those kinds of channels can help tracks crossover and even launch careers (e.g.).

Read full topic
